intro: Thalictrum minus var. kemense, commonly known as the Kemenskaya meadow rue, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. It has a slender, upright stem that can reach up to 1 meter in height. The flowers bloom in early summer and are pollinated primarily by insects.
